master.translation[0].definitions[0].def: someone who is very skilled at something
master.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a work of art by a true master
Runyon was a master of the short story.
Hitchcock was an acknowledged master of suspense.
She’s a master at manipulating people.
master.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a man who has control or authority over servants or workers
master.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
master.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the male owner of a dog
master.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a document, record etc from which copies are made
master.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: I gave him the master to copy.
master.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a wise person whose ideas and words other people accept and follow
master.translation[0].definitions[6].def: used when speaking or referring to a young boy
master.translation[0].definitions[7].def: the person who is in charge of some university colleges in the UK
master.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: the Master of Trinity College, Cambridge
master.translation[0].definitions[8].def: someone who is in charge of a ship
master.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to learn a skill or a language so well that you have no difficulty with it
master.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: the skills needed to master a new language
I never quite mastered the art of walking in high heels.
master.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to manage to control a strong emotion
master.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He had learned to master his fear of heights.
master.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a master copy of a document, recording etc is the one from which copies are made
master.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: the master control center at NASA
master.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a document, record etc from which copies are made
master.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: I gave him the master to copy.
master.translation[4].definitions[0].def: the original thing from which copies are made
master.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: When a large number of copies of the same document are required, they can be photocopied from a master copy.
master.translation[4].definitions[1].def: someone who is very skilled at a job done with their hands and can teach it to other people
master.translation[4].definitions[1].exa: The company now uses semi-skilled operators instead of master bakers.
master.translation[4].definitions[2].def: the most important or main thing
master.translation[4].definitions[2].exa: Mr Bond’s master company, Bond Corporation
